qas.question: Landings were made on the beaches of what island on December 15, 1944?
Lingayen Gulf operations supported what landings?
Clark field was how many miles northwest of Manila?

context: On 15 December 1944 landings against minimal resistance were made on the southern beaches of the island of <a0_0>Mindoro<a0_0/>, a key location in the planned Lingayen Gulf operations, in support of major landings scheduled on <a1_0>Luzon<a1_0/>. On 9 January 1945, on the south shore of Lingayen Gulf on the western coast of Luzon, <a2_0>General Krueger<a2_0/>'s Sixth Army landed his first units. Almost 175,000 men followed across the twenty-mile (32 km) beachhead within a few days. With heavy air support, Army units pushed inland, taking Clark Field, <a3_0>40<a3_0/> miles (64 km) northwest of Manila, in the last week of January.
